related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @Andrea3i is experiencing issues with the OS toolbar not launching when clicked from Visual Studio, the desktop app, or directly.
* The issue also includes Pieces OS restarting unexpectedly.
* @robert-at-pieces initially suspects a problem with the Visual Studio plugin initialization but later discovers a broader OS error. 

**Problems identified:**

* The OS toolbar fails to launch in all scenarios.
* Pieces OS restarts unexpectedly.
* The exact reason for the OS error is unclear due to missing information.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @robert-at-pieces proposes updates to the Visual Studio plugin and Pieces OS.
* They suggest gathering a screen recording to further diagnose the issue.
* @mark-at-pieces proposes debugging the issue with further assistance from @Andrea3i.
* @robert-at-pieces suggests running a utility to obtain the OS error code for precise diagnosis.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The updated Visual Studio plugin and Pieces OS versions haven't resolved the issue.
* The OS error code needs to be retrieved for further diagnosis.
* A debugging session is scheduled to gather more information.

**Note:**

* The provided logs may hold valuable information for troubleshooting.
* The conversation suggests ongoing communication and collaboration to resolve the issue.

related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User @hra42 reported an issue with onboarding snippets and onboarding conversations not being generated after deleting local database.
* The user followed specific steps, including closing pOS and PfD, deleting relevant folders, and restarting the applications.

**Problems identified:**

* A bug was identified preventing the generation of onboarding snippets and conversations when the local database was deleted but the `com.pieces.pfd` folder was not.
* Additionally, the user encountered a `PERMISSION_DENIED` error when interacting with GPT Inference Service. 

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @mack-at-pieces confirmed the bug and provided information about the `PERMISSION_DENIED` error. 

**Current status/outcome:**

* The status of the bug fix and error resolution remains unclear from the conversation provided.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems to be specific to users who are existing Pieces users and delete their local databases. 
* More information is needed to determine the final resolution and outcome of this issue.
